wpt.name: GC1565W
wpt.desc: Between Millstone Mountain and Pond by MikeOtt, Traditional Cache (2/2.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Between Millstone Mountain and Pond
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This cache is located in the Carpenter Area of White Clay Creek State Park, that is reached from Rt 896. From March to November this is a fee area-$3 for instate cars, $6 for out of state cars. (Better yet get an annual pass to all the Delaware State parks for $27)

It is being released at the same time as a geocaching event in the park hosted by WhiteClayLover

The initial cache was located in a high muggle area that is a fun place to go to. The rock outcropping was used to quarry millstones. You can see a partly made milstone that was abandoned at the cache site. There are some large steep rock so caution is required.

The GPS was jumping lots, but the name should clue you in on where to look. It is a large size plastic coffee container that has camo paint. Please keep it well hidden since this area gets a lot of activity

The is replacement cache that perviously was named "HIGH ATOP MILLSTONE MOUNTAIN", but muggles were too much of a problem at that location

There is a letterbox about 20 paces back from the summit of Millstone Mt. if you want another challange
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Under boardwalk next to large tree

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: I used to come to this park all the time as a kid, but I hadn't realized how much there was to this place.
